summary:
Eugene Rurangwa PhD is a scientist with 30 years of international work experience in the agriculture sector with technical expertise and specialisation in aquatic production systems. He focusses his research activities on the development and application of technological tools to improve sustainability, efficiency and profitability in aquaculture. He has managed and worked on national and international complex projects in: (1) sustainable aquaculture production, environmental impact of intensive aquaculture, aquatic toxicology, microbial management in fish and systems, (2) fish market and value chain analysis, scans and feasibility studies, fish by-product valorisation, fish for food and nutrition security, (3) inclusive businesses development for the private sector and smallholders and, (4) capacity building and curricula development.

Country project work experience: Belgium, Germany, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, UK, USA, Algeria, Benin, Ethiopia, Ghana, Kenya, Mali, Nigeria, Rwanda, South Africa and Tanzania. He has a large network with academics, the public and private sectors in Europe and in both French and English speaking countries in Africa.

Native from Rwanda, East Africa, he has worked and lived between Belgium, The Netherlands and the African continent. With a good understanding of both the Western and the African cultures, he is a perfect quadrilingual and proficient user of English, French, Dutch and Kinyarwanda.
